intro: Conospermum brachyphyllum, commonly known as the broad-leaved conospermum, is a shrub native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its dense, rounded growth habit and narrow, leathery leaves. It produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of pink or white, typically in spring. Conospermum brachyphyllum is often used in coastal landscapes due to its tolerance of salty air and well-drained soils.
